AttributeList.Text: Add more conditions here
Check running condition: system initialized
Check running condition: oil temperature OK
Check running condition: shaft seal system OK
Check running conditions: heat source OK
NOTE: leave a little headroom to the limit for standby, otherwise the machine shuts down (via alarm 2101) at the same temperature as it should go to standby on
Check running condition: heat sink OK

LineComment.Text: Rewritten with user-defined limits and right-side-up logic
Also don't evaluate the condition unless it's relevant, to avoid odd conditions during earlier states/cold start setting this accidentally

AttributeList.Text:
Recuperator sits between evaporator and compressor and SHOULD INCREASE THE SUPERHEAT (ie delta T over the recuperator should be positive)
Recuperator window: must add at least "DB_CurrentSetting".MissingSetting.System.RecuperatorSuperheatGainWorking degrees to be considered working, but can then fall as low as "DB_CurrentSetting".MissingSetting.System.RecuperatorSuperheatGainNotWorking degrees before it is considered not working again
Check running condition: recuperator working
Check running condition: superheat compressor discharge OK
Give a small margin for error, so if it sits at, for example 288.2 RPM and the limit is 290, it will work.
Check running condition: at or above hydrolock speed
Check running condition: suction line dry
Check running condition: auxiliaries OK

The simplest is to just look at the regulator's .bAtSetpoint bit. But the lubrication priming pump may be too small to reach the setpoint. So a hybrid condition is: IF the pressure is at setpoint OR the motor has been running for at least X sec when not at setpoint AND the developed lubrication pressure is greater than Y kPa THEN the lubrication system is working ok. NOTE: hardcoded params = bad!!
Check running condition: lubrication priming OK
Think of an appropriate condition
Check if warm start is possible
Check machine condition: compressor stopped
NOte: stop conditions are evaluated by FB30 StartStopControl
Stop required
Check for risk of hydrolock
Standby state minimum dwell time
Minimum pause in Standby before resume
Standby pause time
PrepareStart state minimum dwell time
Start state minimum dwell time
Warmup minimum dwell time
Stopping minimum dwell time
Evaluate machine state conditions
